result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karisa Marie Evans

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Karisa Marie Evans in court.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court for Karisa Marie Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Court orders documents to be filed five days prior to the final pre-trial date. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Karisa Marie Evans in court.  Attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo in court for Karisa Marie Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense requests a status conference for reasons placed on the record.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Karisa Marie Evans in court with attorney Luis Javier Irizarry Lugo.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karisa Marie Evans appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel has not received discovery and offer and requests additional time to receive and review.
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.A.B.; Z.D.K
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

09:51 AM Defendant Karisa Marie Evans in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Karisa Marie Evans in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karisa Marie Evans appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling.  Defendant at Fond Du Lac Correctional.
Return on Warrant/Initial appearance scheduled via Zoom.  Defendant has been released from MSDF.  Appearance has been cancelled.  DA's office will be contacted to send summons.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Karisa Marie Evans not in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/20/22 @ 1:30p
